website_summaries.verdict: Sharp, beautiful silver blades and smooth handles from a reputable name in cutlery.
pros: Rounded handles feel good in the hand
cons: The serrated edges will be a turnoff to some people

customer_reviews.title: No rust- dishwasher safe
customer_reviews.text: Love these steak knives. Bought these as an addition to the knife block. Just needed more steak knives. Needed to find knives that are dish washer safe. We have a well which has minerals in it. Previous knives always rusted when putting them in the dishwasher. Knives have a good weight to them too. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nancjam

customer_reviews.title: Great Knives
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before purchasing. As a lefty, one review that caused me pause was being difficult for left-handers. I'm glad I ignored that review, the knives are effective for lefties. In addition, the knives aren't too large and they cut meats just fine; no shredding as one reviewer complained about.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Teeuwen

customer_reviews.title: Grabs and chews, doesn't cut cleanly
customer_reviews.text: I have an older German set of Henckels steak knives that have served me well for 20 years, but it was only a set of four, so I wanted four more to make eight. These new Chinese made Henkel knives have super tall serrations on them that grab the food, and tear it instead of cleanly cutting it. Want a nice smooth tomato cut? Forget about with theses knives.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Substantial and easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: I love these knives! I purchased them to complete a 13 piece block set I received as a gift. The knives are fantastic - and the material on the handles is just what I was looking for. They do not slip in your hands when they are wet. I highly recommend this set!
customer_reviews.author: Tannerlayton

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and comfortable but tarnishes
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these knives as my "daily drivers". The are comfortable to hold and sharp to cut with, but will not hold up in the dishwasher. I have eight of these and every single one has rust spots on the blades (the handles are fine). If you want steak knives that you have to hand wash all the time these might be an OK option.
customer_reviews.author: DaDane

customer_reviews.title: bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: I needed steak knives for my new apartment and these are really great quality. Heavy enough to make a good cut in cooked meats. Also the coupon helped bring the cost down of already reasonably prices steak knives
customer_reviews.author: lexi

customer_reviews.title: Great looking knives with good weight and balance. Excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.text: For years I've wanted to find steak knives that don't have wooden handles, and here they are. Very nice knives that feel great in the hand and look fabulous. Sadly, one of the knives in our 2 packs had minor scrape on one of the handles, but the blemish is hardly noticeable so not worth returning (from overseas). Overall, absolutely love these knives: could be enhanced by having a nice presentation case in which you can store 8-12 knives.
customer_reviews.author: smokescreen

customer_reviews.title: Great steak knives
customer_reviews.text: These are large sized heavy steak knives. We think they are lovely. The textured handles are very comfortable to hold. We've only had them for a couple of months, but they show no signs of tarnish or wear so far. The serrations on these knives are tighter and more vertical than most steak knives. They do cut cleanly, but I find less pressure and more horizontal motion, more like a sawing motion, works well.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I only used it a few times and it’s staring to rust.
customer_reviews.author: Island butterfly

customer_reviews.title: Like a saw
customer_reviews.text: Too big and thick of a blade. Instead of slicing through my steak I feel I am sawing through it. Wish I had not bought these. Less sharp of a tool than my breadknife.
customer_reviews.author: Diane b

customer_reviews.title: Terrible quality, very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: These are terribly not sharp. My cheap flexible thin-steel knives cut better than these and they are 10+ years old. Really wish I could return. Couldn’t even cut through perfectly tender chicken.
customer_reviews.author: tripdr

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: These are ok, but lack a quality feel and cut. They have gotten a little chalky from the dishwasher, but not horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: Great steak knives!!
customer_reviews.text: We love these knives! Very sharp and feel great in your hand. Very sharp looking. Only have had then for a month - so can’t vouch for durability yet. Great so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Marian Quigley

customer_reviews.title: Good knives
customer_reviews.text: They are good quality but made in China. If you don't hand wash they will rust, beware
customer_reviews.author: Molly Renteria

customer_reviews.title: Made (Poorly) In China
customer_reviews.text: These knives are made in China and discolored and stained after only a couple of uses. Not worth the price, since you're buying cheaply made knives with a premium brand name.
customer_reviews.author: S. D'Aleo

customer_reviews.title: Huge disappointment
customer_reviews.text: These knives were a huge disappointment. I bought these because I’ve own Henckel knives before and they were great. These rusted quickly and were not the quality I expect from Henckel.
customer_reviews.author: Tim I.

customer_reviews.title: One piece construction
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, well made knives. Cut well and clean up easily.
customer_reviews.author: Metroh

customer_reviews.title: Rusting already
customer_reviews.text: We have been using these knives for two weeks and they are already beginning to rust. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Blair Hyatt

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and ergonomic
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful but the handles scratch easily. They work very well.
customer_reviews.author: Zippy

customer_reviews.title: Sharp looks, sharp knives
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect! Looks great with my silverware and are very sharp. Cuts through steak like butter. Had them for 2 months and they seem to clean up easily. No rust or dulling that I can see (I hand wash them)
customer_reviews.author: Nina From Nowhere

customer_reviews.title: Great knives.  Exactly what I was looking for to complete my set.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these knives to complete the 11 pc block set I had chosen as my anniversary gift at work, but didn't come with steak knives. Was worried they wouldn't be sharp or would be a lower quality than the knives I had because they were lower cost but they are great. The tips are serrated but the base its a straight blade. Family used these at Christmas and all gave rave reviews. I would highly recommend these. I think I paid less than $17 for a set of 4.
customer_reviews.author: Huskerpam

customer_reviews.title: It’s great to have steak knives that actually cut steak
customer_reviews.text: I’d forgotten what sharp steak knives were like. These are so much better than the cheap set I’ve been using for decades. Those were a bridal shower gift from a notoriously frugal family member, so let’s just say they weren’t top quality and leave it at that. These knives, by contrast, feel nice in my hand, are easy to use -and they cut steak and other tough or fibrous plant and animal foods very nicely. I think they’ll last for decades too.
customer_reviews.author: Nightfall

customer_reviews.title: All Hat; No Cattle!
customer_reviews.text: These have the Henckels name, and not much else. They look good, and they will cut like any other serrated knife, but after only a few washings they are starting to show rust on the blades. My old set of knives did that too, eventually, but they cost a lot less, and didn't began showing rust until they were several years old. Very disappointed. Fine German name; cheap Chinese knife!
customer_reviews.author: Carson Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I reorder the knives because my old Henckel’s were becoming dull. There is not comparison between these and my original ones. New ones are heavier which is fine, but they do not Cut very well at all. I should have returned then but have missed the return date by a couple of days. Made in China instead Of Europe and just not as good.
customer_reviews.author: Ronny L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great knifes and super sharp
customer_reviews.text: Great knifes and super sharp! Got them as an addon to the Henckels knife set we've had for over 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars
customer_reviews.text: These are a tad light and do rust, but are very pretty.
customer_reviews.author: Homestead maker

customer_reviews.title: Not the best.  But OK  Graphite Steak knife
customer_reviews.text: I had a set before and it was much lighter than these. They do cut well, but heavy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: BarbR

customer_reviews.title: great Steak knife
customer_reviews.text: Feels great in your hand. Cuts Great. From the best well known knife company. Doesn't get any better than that!
customer_reviews.author: gt max stylas pen

customer_reviews.title: Skip these knives
customer_reviews.text: These knives are not sharp and they tear meat--they do not cut. They have been used fewer than 5 times and have not been put in the dishwasher. Save your money and buy something better.
customer_reviews.author: ln

customer_reviews.title: Liked the serrated edge but the tips are unnecessarily sharp/pointy
customer_reviews.text: Started rusting after only 2 months of light use. Scrubbed and scrubbed but the rust stain would not come off. Finally had to use Bar Keepers Friend to get rid of the rust. Why would quality stainless steal rust? Liked the serrated edge but the tips are unnecessarily sharp/pointy.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Great steak knife.
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with Henckels knives, a German knife company. The look is rather modern, cuts the steaks easily. They are pretty sturdy too. This is the second set I bought, I recommend them highly.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Attractive but AWFUL steak knives
customer_reviews.text: Has any of these reviewers actually tried eating a steak with these? These knives do not cut through a steak cleanly, the knife shreds the meat. Awful. Like doing fine carpentry with a rough tree limb saw. I don't think the German knife company understands the American idea of a serrated steak knife, since most perform poorly. Also the rounded end of the handle serves no good purpose except to show the logo. These knives are not designed to be used.
customer_reviews.author: cthulhuian

customer_reviews.title: Steak nifes
customer_reviews.text: Sharp nifes , comfort to hold in hands, looks good, quality is good to this price .
customer_reviews.author: MILA V.

product_meta.title: J.A. Henckels International Modernist 4-pc Steak Knife Set
product_meta.description: Size:4.5-Inch| Color:Stainless SteelThe Henckels International Modernist steak knives feature a fully forged bolster for sturdy, balanced cutting. Equally ergonomic and stylish, the lightweight, stainless steel handles have an easy-to-grip, sandblasted Texture and a polished, logo-embossed stainless end cap that adds aesthetic appeal to your knife block. The serrated blade means a lifetime of sharpness. Hi Modernist stands for superb quality at a remarkable value.
feature_bullets: Polished end cap with embossed logo
Hi Modernist stands for superb quality at a remarkable value

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars93 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
